Hi Randolph,


Thanks for working on this!


>   1. Is the file header different on Windows because of the  
> difference in newline convention?


No, a single newline ('\n') character should terminate each header  
line no matter what system you're on.  A carriage return ('\r') will  
be ignored, and not produced by any of the Radiance tools.


>   2. Is *Rendering with Radiance* still available from Booksurge?


You can buy it from Amazon:


	http://www.amazon.com/Rendering-Radiance-Science-Lighting- 
Visualization/dp/0974538108/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/002-5711964-3059265? 
ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1186177315&sr=8-1


The link perpetually says it's out of stock, but since it's print-on- 
demand, it doesn't matter.  I think it comes from BookSurge, but I  
don't think they have a link for it anymore.


Cheers,
-Greg
